place.name: HEDENHAM
place.gazetteerText: HEDENHAM, a village and a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk. The village stands on the SE border of the county, 3 miles NW by N of Bungay r. station; and has a post office under Bungay. The parish comprises 1, 770 acres. Real property, £2, 516. Pop., 280. Houses, 59. The property is divided among a few. Hedenham Hall is a chief residence. The manor belongs to F. W. Irby, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £458.* Patron, J. L. Bedingfield, Esq. The church is good; has a square tower; and contains monuments of the Bedingfields and the Garneys. There are a national school, and charities £89. Two Roman urns were found in 1858. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
